studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: Brolucizumab 6 mg
arms.description: Intravitreal injection of 6 mg brolucizumab. Loading phase: 3 injections every 6 weeks (q6w) at Baseline, Week 6, and Week 12. Maintenance phase: q12w injections through Week 90, with potential extension up to q24w after Week 48.

arms.name: Panretinal Photocoagulation (PRP)
arms.description: Initial laser treatment in 1-4 sessions up to Week 12, followed by additional PRP treatment as needed up to Week 90.

studyElements.name: Brolucizumab 6 mg - Screening period
studyElements.description: Treatment period for Brolucizumab 6 mg during Screening period

studyElements.name: Brolucizumab 6 mg - Single-masked treatment period
studyElements.description: Treatment period for Brolucizumab 6 mg during Single-masked treatment period

studyElements.name: Brolucizumab 6 mg - Post-treatment follow-up period
studyElements.description: Treatment period for Brolucizumab 6 mg during Post-treatment follow-up period

studyElements.name: Panretinal Photocoagulation (PRP) - Screening period
studyElements.description: Treatment period for Panretinal Photocoagulation (PRP) during Screening period

studyElements.name: Panretinal Photocoagulation (PRP) - Single-masked treatment period
studyElements.description: Treatment period for Panretinal Photocoagulation (PRP) during Single-masked treatment period

studyElements.name: Panretinal Photocoagulation (PRP) - Post-treatment follow-up period
studyElements.description: Treatment period for Panretinal Photocoagulation (PRP) during Post-treatment follow-up period

maskingRoles.text: Subject is masked in this Single Blind study
Outcome Assessor is masked in this Single Blind study
Data Analyst is masked in this Single Blind study

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population defined by eligibility criteria

objectives.name: Primary Efficacy Objective
objectives.text: To demonstrate that brolucizumab is non-inferior to PRP with respect to the change from Baseline in visual acuity at Week 54 by assessing the change from Baseline in best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) at Week 54

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective - DR Severity
objectives.text: To demonstrate that brolucizumab is superior to PRP in reducing diabetic retinopathy (DR) severity after 54 weeks of treatment by assessing the proportion of subjects with no PDR at Week 54

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective - DME Prevention
objectives.text: To demonstrate that brolucizumab is superior to PRP in preventing the development of center-involved diabetic macular edema (DME) up to Week 54 by assessing the proportion of subjects with center-involved DME up to Week 54

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective - Visual Acuity AUC
objectives.text: To compare the effect of brolucizumab relative to PRP with respect to visual acuity by assessing the area under the curve in change from Baseline in BCVA up to Week 54 and Week 96

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective - DR Status
objectives.text: To compare the effect of brolucizumab relative to PRP on DR status by assessing the change from Baseline in ETDRS diabetic retinopathy severity scale (DRSS) score at Week 54 and Week 96 and the proportion of subjects with no PDR at Week 96

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective - Ocular Complications
objectives.text: To compare the effect of brolucizumab relative to PRP on ocular complications by assessing the proportion of subjects developing vision-threatening complications associated with DR up to Week 54 and Week 96 and the proportion of subjects with center-involved DME up to Week 96

objectives.name: Secondary Safety Objective
objectives.text: To assess the safety and tolerability of brolucizumab relative to PRP

endpoints.name: Primary Efficacy Endpoint
endpoints.text: Change from Baseline in BCVA at Week 54

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - No PDR at Week 54
endpoints.text: Proportion of subjects with no PDR at Week 54

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - DME up to Week 54
endpoints.text: Proportion of subjects with center-involved DME up to Week 54

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - BCVA AUC
endpoints.text: Area under the curve in change from Baseline in BCVA up to Week 54 and Week 96

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - DRSS Score
endpoints.text: Change from Baseline in ETDRS Diabetic Retinopathy Severity Scale (DRSS) score at Week 54 and Week 96

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - No PDR at Week 96
endpoints.text: Proportion of subjects with no PDR at Week 96

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - Vision-threatening Complications
endpoints.text: Proportion of study eyes developing vision-threatening complications associated with diabetic retinopathy up to Week 54 and Week 96

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - DME up to Week 96
endpoints.text: Proportion of subjects with center-involved DME up to Week 96

endpoints.name: Secondary Safety Endpoint
endpoints.text: Incidence of ocular and non-ocular adverse events (AE) up to Week 54 and Week 96

estimands.name: Primary Efficacy Estimand
estimands.populationSummary: Adult patients with proliferative diabetic retinopathy (PDR) and BCVA â‰¥ 34 ETDRS letters Summary measure: Difference in least squares means.

intercurrentEvents.name: Alternative DR/DME treatment
intercurrentEvents.text: Application of alternative diabetic retinopathy or diabetic macular edema treatments to the study eye

intercurrentEvents.name: Treatment discontinuation
intercurrentEvents.text: Permanent discontinuation of study treatment prior to Week 54

estimands.treatment: Brolucizumab 6 mg (3 x q6w loading then q12w maintenance) vs Panretinal photocoagulation (PRP)
estimands.analysisPopulation: Adult patients with proliferative diabetic retinopathy (PDR) and BCVA â‰¥ 34 ETDRS letters
estimands.variableOfInterest: Change from Baseline in BCVA at Week 54

estimands.name: First Key Secondary Estimand
estimands.populationSummary: Adult patients with proliferative diabetic retinopathy (PDR) and BCVA â‰¥ 34 ETDRS letters Summary measure: Odds ratio or risk difference.

intercurrentEvents.name: Death
intercurrentEvents.text: Death of the subject prior to Week 54

estimands.analysisPopulation: Adult patients with proliferative diabetic retinopathy (PDR) and BCVA â‰¥ 34 ETDRS letters
estimands.variableOfInterest: Proportion of subjects with no PDR (DRSS score < 61) at Week 54

estimands.name: DME Prevention Estimand
estimands.populationSummary: Adult patients with PDR and no center-involved DME at baseline Summary measure: Odds ratio or risk difference.

intercurrentEvents.name: Treatment discontinuation due to AE
intercurrentEvents.text: Discontinuation of treatment due to adverse events (e.g., retinal vasculitis)

estimands.analysisPopulation: Adult patients with PDR and no center-involved DME at baseline
estimands.variableOfInterest: Proportion of subjects with center-involved DME up to Week 54

exits.name: Withdrawal of Consent
exits.description: Participant explicitly requests to stop use of data/samples and stop treatment

exits.name: Study Completion
exits.description: Last randomized subject finishes EOS visit at Week 96

exits.name: Sponsor Termination
exits.description: Novartis may terminate the study at any time for benefit/risk or practical reasons

analysisPopulations.name: All Enrolled Set
analysisPopulations.text: Includes all subjects who have signed informed consent and are assigned subject numbers.
analysisPopulations.label: All Enrolled Set
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: Includes all subjects who have signed informed consent and are assigned subject numbers.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Signed informed consent AND assigned subject number

analysisPopulations.name: Randomized Set
analysisPopulations.text: Consists of all randomized subjects. Subjects are considered randomized when they have been deemed eligible for randomization by the investigator and given a randomization number. Subjects who were randomized but did not receive any study treatment at baseline and discontinued study per subject decision will be classified as screen failures.
analysisPopulations.label: Randomized Set
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: Consists of all randomized subjects. Subjects are considered randomized when they have been deemed eligible for randomization by the investigator and given a randomization number. Subjects who were randomized but did not receive any study treatment at baseline and discontinued study per subject decision will be classified as screen failures.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Deemed eligible for randomization AND assigned randomization number

analysisPopulations.name: Full Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: Comprises all randomized subjects who receive at least one study treatment. Subjects in the FAS will be analyzed according to the treatment assigned to them at randomization.
analysisPopulations.label: FAS
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: Comprises all randomized subjects who receive at least one study treatment. Subjects in the FAS will be analyzed according to the treatment assigned to them at randomization.

analysisPopulations.name: Safety Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: Includes all subjects who receive at least one study treatment. Subjects in the SAF will be analyzed according to the actual study treatment they received, where treatment received is defined as the randomized/assigned treatment if the subject took at least one dose of that treatment, or the first treatment received if the randomized/assigned treatment was never received.
analysisPopulations.label: SAF
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: Includes all subjects who receive at least one study treatment. Subjects in the SAF will be analyzed according to the actual study treatment they received, where treatment received is defined as the randomized/assigned treatment if the subject took at least one dose of that treatment, or the first treatment received if the randomized/assigned treatment was never received.

analysisPopulations.name: Per Protocol Set
analysisPopulations.text: A subset of the FAS and will exclude or censor data from subjects with important protocol deviations (PDs) and analysis restrictions (ARs) that are expected to majorly affect the validity of the assessment of efficacy at Week 54.
analysisPopulations.label: PPS
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: A subset of the FAS and will exclude or censor data from subjects with important protocol deviations (PDs) and analysis restrictions (ARs) that are expected to majorly affect the validity of the assessment of efficacy at Week 54.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Included in FAS AND no important protocol deviations/analysis restrictions affecting efficacy validity

BCVA_Baseline", "successCriteria": "Lower limit of the two-sided 95% CI for the least square mean difference (brolucizumab - PRP) > -4 ETDRS letters", "sourceText": "The objective related to the primary endpoint is to demonstrate non-inferiority of brolucizumab versus PRP with respect to the change from Baseline in BCVA at Week 54, assuming a non-inferiority margi"}, {"id": "7ad9bf79-2a86-4e3c-b513-4eeb976dbdf2", "name": "First Key Secondary: Proportion of subjects with no PDR", "endpointType": "Secondary", "inputs": ["PDR status at Week 54"], "timeWindow": {"reference": "Baseline", "duration": "54 weeks"}, "algorithm": "(Count of subjects with no PDR at Week 54) / (Total subjects in treatment arm)", "successCriteria": "Superiority of brolucizumab versus PRP via CMH test (one-sided p < 0.025) after primary endpoint non-inferiority is established", "sourceText": "The objective related to first key secondary endpoint is to demonstrate superiority of brolucizumab versus PRP with respect to increasing the proportion of subjects with no PDR at Week 54."}, {"id": "1e60dde2-3d34-4fdb-9272-8e8b80cb17cf", "name": "Other Key Secondary: Proportion of subjects with center-involved DME", "endpointType": "Secondary", "inputs": ["DME status up to Week 54"], "timeWindow": {"reference": "Baseline", "duration": "Up to 54 weeks"}, "algorithm": "(Count of subjects with center-involved DME up to Week 54) / (Total subjects in treatment arm)", "successCriteria": "Superiority of brolucizumab versus PRP via CMH test (one-sided p < 0.025) after primary and first key secondary superiority are established", "sourceText": "The objective related to the other key secondary endpoint is to demonstrate superiority of brolucizumab versus PRP with respect to reducing the proportion of subjects with center-involved DME up to We"}]

administrations.name: Brolucizumab Administration
administrations.description: tients with proliferative diabetic retinopathy (PDR). Subjects who meet all the inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio to one of the two treatment arms: â€¢ Brolu

administrations.name: RTH258 Administration
administrations.description: Study treatment 6.1.1 Investigational drug Table 6-1 Investigational drug Investigational Drug Pharmaceutical Dosage Form Route of Administration Supply Type Sponsor Brolucizumab 6 mg (RTH258 6 mg/ 0.

titles.text: A 96-week, two-arm, randomized, single-masked, multi-center, phase III study assessing the efficacy and safety of brolucizumab 6 mg compared to panretinal photocoagulation laser in patients with proliferative diabetic retinopathy (CONDOR)

organizations.name: Blue Oc Clin Res at Palm Bch Eye Ct
Retina Associates Of South Texas PA

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Informed Consent
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Signed informed consent must be obtained prior to participation in the study.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age Requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Patients â‰¥ 18 years of age at Screening.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Participant Cooperation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participant cooperation sufficient for adequate fundus photographs and retinal images.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Diabetes Diagnosis and HbA1c
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Patients diagnosed with type 1 or 2 DM, and HbA1c â‰¤ 12% at Screening.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Stable Diabetes Medication
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any medication administered for the management of DM should be stable within 3 months prior to randomization and is expected to remain stable during the course of the study, as medically acceptable.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: PDR Diagnosis Study Eye
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: PDR as assessed by the investigator using standard or wide-field CFP and FA, with no evidence of previous PRP, and that requires treatment with either anti-VEGF or PRP in the opinion of the investigator.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: BCVA Requirement Study Eye
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: BCVA â‰¥ 34 ETDRS letters (Snellen equivalent 20/200) at Screening and Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Concomitant Ocular Disorders
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Concomitant conditions or ocular disorders in the study eye at Screening or Baseline as well as planned medical/surgical intervention during the first 54-week study period that could compromise functional or structural response to study treatment, in the opinion of the investigator.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Center-involved DME
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Presence of center-involved diabetic macular edema in the study eye at Screening or Baseline, as assessed by the investigator.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Active Infection or Inflammation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any active intraocular or periocular infection or active intraocular inflammation (e.g. infectious conjunctivitis, keratitis, scleritis, infectious blepharitis, uveitis) in the study eye at Screening or Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Uncontrolled Glaucoma
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Uncontrolled glaucoma in the study eye defined as IOP > 25 mmHg despite treatment with IOP-lowering medication, or according to investigatorâ€™s judgment, at Screening or Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Vitreous Hemorrhage
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Moderate or dense pre-retinal or vitreous hemorrhage that prevents clear visualization of the macular and /or optic disc or prevents PRP treatment in the study eye at Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Vitreoretinal Proliferation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Significant fibrovascular vitreoretinal proliferation or tractional retinal detachment of the study eye.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Neovascularization
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Iris or anterior chamber angle neovascularization, or neovascular glaucoma in the study eye.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Fellow Eye Condition
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Presence of amblyopia, amaurosis, or ocular disorders in the fellow eye with BCVA < 20/200 at Screening (except when due to conditions for which treatment or surgery may improve VA, e.g. cataract).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior PRP
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: PRP any time prior to Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior Anti-VEGF
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Intravitreal anti-VEGF treatment within 6 months prior to Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Vitreoretinal Surgery
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Vitreoretinal surgery at any time prior to Baseline or anticipated need for vitreoretinal surgery within the next 12 months.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Macular Laser
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Laser treatment of the macula within 3 months prior to Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Corticosteroid Implants
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Treatment with fluocinolone acetonide intravitreal implant (e.g. ILUVIENÂ® or RETISERTÂ®) at any time prior to Baseline. Other intraocular or periocular corticosteroid injection within 6 months prior to Baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Aphakia
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Aphakia with the absence of posterior capsule.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Intraocular Surgery
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Intraocular surgery within 3 months prior to Baseline or anticipated need for cataract extraction within the next 12 months.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Stroke or MI
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Stroke or myocardial infarction during the 6-month period prior to baseline.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Renal Disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: End stage renal disease requiring dialysis or renal transplant.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Uncontrolled Blood Pressure
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Uncontrolled blood pressure defined as a systolic value â‰¥ 180 mmHg or diastolic value â‰¥ 100 mmHg at screening or baseline. (In case there is an elevated blood pressure measurement, it should be repeated after approximately 20 minutes. If the repeat measurement is elevated, then the patient is not eligible to be enrolled into the study).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Systemic Anti-VEGF
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Systemic anti-VEGF therapy at any time.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Toxic Systemic Medications
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Systemic medications known to be toxic to the lens, retina or optic nerve (e.g., deferoxamine, chloroquine/hydroxychloroquine, tamoxifen, phenothiazines and ethambutol) used during the 6â€‘month period prior to Baseline except temporary use for Coronavirus 19 (COVID-19) treatment.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hypersensitivity
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of hypersensitivity to any of the study drugs or their excipients or to drugs of similar classes, or clinically relevant sensitivity to fluorescein dye as assessed by the investigator.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: History of Malignancy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of malignancy of any organ system (other than localized basal cell carcinoma of the skin or in situ cervical cancer), treated or untreated, within the past 5 years prior to Screening, regardless of whether there is evidence of local recurrence or metastases.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: General Medical Condition
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of a medical condition (e.g. metabolic dysfunction disease with exception of type 1 or 2 DM, or clinical laboratory finding) that, in the judgment of the investigator, would preclude scheduled study visits, completion of the study, or a safe administration of investigational product.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Investigational Drugs
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Use of systemic investigational drugs within 5 half-lives of baseline, or within 30 days / until the expected pharmacodynamic effect has returned to baseline, whichever is longer; or longer if required by local regulations (observational clinical studies solely involving over-the-counter vitamins, supplements, or diets are not exclusionary).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Pregnancy and Nursing
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Pregnant or nursing (lactating) women, where pregnancy is defined as the state of a female after conception and until the termination of gestation, confirmed by a positive human chorionic gonadotropin pregnancy test.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Contraception Requirements
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Women of child-bearing potential, defined as all women physiologically capable of becoming pregnant, unless they are using highly effective methods of contraception during the study drug administration and for at least one month after stopping the investigational medication.

studyInterventions.name: Brolucizumab 6 mg
studyInterventions.description: Anti-VEGF single-chain antibody fragment (scFv) for proliferative diabetic retinopathy

studyInterventions.name: Panretinal photocoagulation (PRP)
studyInterventions.description: Standard of care laser treatment for proliferative diabetic retinopathy

studyInterventions.name: Topical ocular medications
studyInterventions.description: Permitted during the study, including corticosteroids

studyInterventions.name: Corticosteroids (non-ocular)
studyInterventions.description: Permitted via intra-nasal, inhaled, intra-articular, or non-extensive dermal routes

studyInterventions.name: Anti-VEGF therapy (other than study drug)
studyInterventions.description: Prohibited in the study eye and systemically

studyInterventions.name: Fluocinolone acetonide intravitreal implant
studyInterventions.description: Prohibited prior to baseline and during study

abbreviations.expandedText: International Council for Harmonization of Technical Requirements for Registration of Pharmaceuticals for Human Use

amendments.name: Amendment 2

code.decode: Protocol Amendment

amendments.summary: The main purpose of this amendment is to implement the Urgent Safety Measures (USM) described in the 10-Aug-2021 Dear Investigator Letter (DIL) into the study protocol. The USM were implemented in response to the identification of a causal immune-mediated mechanism of the previously identified risk of retinal vasculitis (RV), and/or retinal vascular occlusion (RO), typically in the presence of intraocular inflammation (IOI) indicating a requirement to discontinue treatment in patients who develop events of RV and/or RO. This amendment also includes information on gender imbalance on IOI following brolucizumab treatment and recommendations on the time window for a study subject to receive the COVID-19 vaccine or vitrectomy.

amendments.name: Amendment 1

code.decode: Protocol Amendment

amendments.summary: The main purpose of this amendment is to provide clarification and guidance on safety assessments in accordance to the urgent safety measure regarding the post-marketing reports with brolucizumab (BeovuÂ®) in the treatment of nAMD, which were identified as retinal vasculitis and/or retinal vascular occlusion, typically in the presence of intraocular inflammation, that may result in severe vision loss. In addition, the amendment includes the modifications due to COVID-19 pandemic.

conditions.name: Intraocular Inflammation (IOI) Sign

study.name: A 96-week, two-arm, randomized, single-masked, multi-center, phase III study assessing the efficacy and safety of brolucizumab 6 mg compared to panretinal photocoagulation laser in patients with proliferative diabetic retinopathy (CONDOR)

administrations.name: Brolucizumab Extension Phase
administrations.doseFrequency: Extended by 6-week increments up to every 24 weeks
administrations.duration: From Week 48 onwards based on disease stability

substances.name: Brolucizumab
substances.description: Single-chain antibody fragment (scFv) inhibitor of vascular endothelial growth factor A (VEGF-A)

studyDefinitionDocument.name: A 96-week, two-arm, randomized, single-masked, multi-center, phase III study assessing the efficacy and safety of brolucizumab 6 mg compared to panretinal photocoagulation laser in patients with proliferative diabetic retinopathy (CONDOR)

transitionRules.name: Brolucizumab Maintenance Extension
transitionRules.text: After Week 48, interval may be extended by 6 weeks up to 24 weeks based on disease activity

transitionRules.name: Mandatory Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Subject develops retinal vasculitis (RV) and/or retinal vascular occlusion (RO)

transitionRules.name: Safety Interruption
transitionRules.text: Interruption of study treatment is allowed if warranted by an Adverse Event

commentAnnotations.text: If any signs of intraocular inflammation are present, then an IVT injection must not be performed.
PRP performed as a day case hospitalization should not be recorded as a serious adverse event (SAE) despite hospitalization.
It is recommended to receive the COVID-19 vaccine at least 7 days before or after the study treatment visit.
Two consecutive injections should be at least 21 days apart.
Trial Feedback Questionnaire is optional and anonymized; responses will not be reviewed by investigators.

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Implementation of Urgent Safety Measures (USM) regarding retinal vasculitis and retinal vascular occlusion.
Clarification on safety assessments and modifications due to COVID-19 pandemic.

studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Mandatory treatment discontinuation for subjects developing retinal vasculitis (RV) and/or retinal vascular occlusion (RO).
Added information regarding gender imbalance observed in intraocular inflammation (IOI) following brolucizumab treatment.
Standardization of pregnancy testing requirements across both study arms.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 6.7.2 - Instructions for administering study treatment
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Prohibition of IVT injection if any sign of intraocular inflammation is present.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Implementation of Urgent Safety Measures (USM) following identification of causal immune-mediated mechanism for RV and RO.
Recommendations on time windows for COVID-19 vaccine or vitrectomy.
Post-marketing reports of retinal vasculitis and/or retinal vascular occlusion in nAMD treatment.
Modifications due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

studyChanges.afterText: Requirement of treatment discontinuation was added if subject developed RV and/or RO, in both arms.
studyChanges.summary: Added mandatory discontinuation rule for RV/RO events.

studyChanges.afterText: Requirement to apply the same pregnancy testing in both arms, throughout the study.
studyChanges.summary: Corrected inconsistency in pregnancy testing protocols between arms.

studyChanges.afterText: If any sign of intraocular inflammation is present, an IVT injection must not be performed.
studyChanges.summary: Emphasized withholding treatment in the presence of IOI.
